content.text: Adobe Career Academy 2.0-for Persons with Disability university students Adobe Career Academy 2.0 for Persons with Disability university students: Details of the program are as follows: Launch April May 2024 Duration 30 days Mode Online Structure Weekly one session in the evening Eligibility Only PwD Engineering students completing their graduation in 2026 Eligible branches 2026 batch B.Tech B.E students specializing in CS, IT, EEE, ECE, Software Engineering, Data Science, Cyber Security, Information Security, Maths and Computing, or any other circuit branch with Computer Science as major or minor Process Registration - Online Assessment - Weekly sessions - Graduation Registration form Register here (Please note that post enrollment, the applicants will have to attempt an online test and only shortlisted students will get a chance to be a part of the academy) Students with any Blood Disorder, Locomotor, Orthopedic disability (who come under the category of PwD mentioned by the RPwD Act, 2016) or any disability that doesn t interfere with their working on computer system are eligible to apply. It is mandatory for the students to have a Disability Certificate to be eligible to apply. Last date of application March 15, 2024
content.original_text:
Adobe Career Academy 2.0-for Persons with Disability university students
Adobe Career Academy 2.0 – for Persons with Disability university students:
Details of the program are as follows: 
Launch
	
April – May 2024
	
Duration
	
30 days
	
Mode
	
Online
	
Structure
	
Weekly one session in the evening
	
Eligibility
	
Only PwD Engineering students completing their graduation in 2026
	
Eligible branches
	
2026 batch B.Tech/ B.E students specializing in CS, IT, EEE, ECE, Software Engineering, Data Science, Cyber Security, Information Security, Maths and Computing, or any other circuit branch with Computer Science as major or minor
	
Process
	
Registration -> Online Assessment -> Weekly sessions -> Graduation
	
Registration form
	
Register here
	
(Please note that post enrollment, the applicants will have to attempt an online test and only shortlisted students will get a chance to be a part of the academy)
Students with any Blood Disorder, Locomotor, Orthopedic disability (who come under the category of PwD mentioned by the RPwD Act, 2016) or any disability that doesn’t interfere with their working on computer system are eligible to apply. It is mandatory for the students to have a Disability Certificate to be eligible to apply.
Last date of application March 15, 2024

content.text: One Day Faculty Induction Program for alignment of NEP recommendation Invitation to attend One Day Faculty Induction Orientation Program for alignment of NEP recommendation and SDG s indicators in to the academic curriculum at the University campus, GD Goenka University, Sohna Road, Gurugram on April 15, 2023 9.00am -.4:00 pm. Hurry up only 05 days has left for registration to attend One Day Faculty Induction Orientation Program for alignment of NEP recommendation and SDG s indicators in to the academic curriculum at the university campus, GD Goenka University, Sohna Road, Gurugram on April 15, 2023 9.00am - 4.00pm, G. D Goenka University provide a facilty for 1 1 scheme. Greetings from GAD-TLC, A centre of the Ministry of Education under PMMMNMTT, that has already trained more than 78,000 teachers since the inception of the GAD-TLC in 2016. They have developed more than 50 MOOCs for SWAYAM platform and completed e-PG Pathshala project and GD Goenka University, a state private university offering degree programs in multidisciplinary areas Inviting the respective dignitaries to attend the one full day Faculty Induction Orientation Program in Hybrid Mode at the University campus on Saturday, April 15, 2023 on integration of NEP recommendation and SDG s indicators in the academic curriculum from the academic session 2023-24. Details of the workshop is as follows: Mode of Event: Hybrid Mode Venue: GD Goenka University, Auditorium, Block B, Main Campus, Sohna Road, Gurugram-122103 Timings: 9.00 am to 4.00 pm Programme Schedule Time Description Speaker 8.30 -9.00 am Registration on Help Desk Team GDGU 9.00 -9.30 am Tea Break 9.30 - 10.30 am Inaugural with Keynote Session Prof. Ved Prakash, Former Chairman, UGC 10.30 - 12.00 pm Session on NEP Alignment Prof. A. K. Bakhshi, Chairman, GAD-TLC 12.00 - 12.15 pm Tea Break 12.15 - 1.30 pm Session on SDG s Indicators alignment Prof. Vimal Rarh, Project Head Joint Director, GAD-TLC 1.30 - 2.15 pm Lunch Break 2.15 - 3.30 pm Hands-on Activity Prof. Vimal Rarh 3.30 - 4.00 pm Feedback and Interactive Session Prof. A.K.Bakhshi Prof. Vimal Rarh Post-Workshop Assignment - To be submitted in a week followed by online subject specific group meetings to improve further and final submission after another week. Online Session Discussion- 2 hours: The final submissions will be analysed by our Team and discussions for further improvement virtually Certificates e-Certificates with unique codes will be provided by GAD-TLC of the Ministry of Education. Two types of certificates for participants: As successful completion of the workshop with 12 hours of participation: For Teachers who will submit the assignment. As participation certificate with 8 hours of participation: For Teachers who will not submit the assignments Benefits of attending this events will be:- 1. Restructuring of the overall framework in accordance to varying credit frameworks brought out by different Regulators (UGC AICTE ICAR Medical council, Bar Council etc); provisions for earning credits up to 40 using MOOCs; Academic Bank of Credits, introduction of add-on courses capacity enhancement courses, internships, etc. 2. Restructuring of Curriculum and content for Outcome based Education by integration of well-designed activities (individual or group), 3. Adoption of newer Teaching-Learning methodologies and tools like flipped classroom, TPS model, enquiry-Based Learning, project based learning, cooperative learning, self-learning to ensure learner- centric approach of teaching and learning. 4. Formulation of scientific and technology empowered multiple assessment methods. Continuous Formative Assessments having greater weightage mapped with learning outcomes; designing Rubrics for group projects skill based courses, portfolios, etc., using different ICT Tools for different types of questions including drag-drop, automated numerical, crossword, audio video based questions, etc. 5. Advantages in accreditation and ranking metric: - Revision of curriculum in leines with NEP and SDG s for academic experts - Teachers receiving financial support for advanced studies - Institutional preparedness for NEP 2020 - Financial support provided by organization to its faculty to attend workshop - Teachers undergoing online Faculty Development Programme Registration Link: Registration Fee: Rs.5,000 - per attendee. Early bird registration by or before April 8, 2023 will get a 50 discount. In case, five faculty register from an organization, next five registration will be free of cost. Invitation to attend One Day "Faculty Induction/ Orientation Program" for alignment of NEP recommendation and SDG's indicators in to the academic curriculum at the University campus, GD Goenka University, Sohna Road, Gurugram on April 15, 2023 9.00am -.4:00 pm.
Hurry up only 05 days has left for registration to attend One Day "Faculty Induction/ Orientation Program" for alignment of NEP recommendation and SDG's indicators in to the academic curriculum at the university campus, GD Goenka University, Sohna Road, Gurugram on April 15, 2023 9.00am - 4.00pm, G. D Goenka University provide a facilty for 1 + 1 scheme. 
Greetings from GAD-TLC, A centre of the Ministry of Education under PMMMNMTT, that has already trained more than 78,000 teachers since the inception of the GAD-TLC in 2016. They have developed more than 50 MOOCs for SWAYAM platform and completed e-PG Pathshala project and GD Goenka University, a state private university offering degree programs in multidisciplinary areas
Inviting the respective dignitaries to attend the one full day "Faculty Induction/ Orientation Program" in Hybrid Mode at the University campus on Saturday, April 15, 2023 on integration of NEP recommendation and SDG's indicators in the academic curriculum from the academic session 2023-24.

content.text: Online talk by Shri Yuvraj Malik, Director, National Book Trust, India The UGC has initiated an online lecture series on Best Practices in Higher Education Eminent persons from different fields are invited on the UGC platform to share the best practices followed in their institution organization, for the benefit of higher educational institutions, faculty members and students. In this lecture series Shri Yuvraj Malik, Director, National Book Trust, India, will be delivering a talk on Orientation session for PM YUVA SCHEME 2.0 on 03.01.2023 at 02:30 PM Shri Malik will talk on the implementation execution, selection procedure of young authors, mentorship schedule, and scholarship of PM Yuva Scheme 2.0. You are requested to join the online lecture as per the schedule mentioned above. The link for joining the programme is as under: Topic: Chetna Lecture, Dr. Yuvraj Director, NBT Time: Jan 3, 2023, 02:30 PM Mumbai, Kolkata, New Delhi Join Zoom Meeting Meeting ID: 883 6479 8709 Passcode: 597141
content.original_text:
Online talk by Shri Yuvraj Malik, Director, National Book Trust, India
The UGC has initiated an online lecture series on Best Practices in Higher Education Eminent persons from different fields are invited on the UGC platform to share the best practices followed in their institution/organization, for the benefit of higher educational institutions, faculty members and students.
In this lecture series Shri Yuvraj Malik, Director, National Book Trust, India, will be delivering a talk on Orientation session for PM YUVA SCHEME 2.0 on 03.01.2023 at 02:30 PM Shri Malik will talk on the implementation & execution, selection procedure of young authors, mentorship schedule, and scholarship of PM Yuva Scheme 2.0. 
You are requested to join the online lecture as per the schedule mentioned above. The link for joining the programme is as under:

content.text: Launch of Redesigned UGC Website, UTSAH Professor of Practice Portal Launch of Redesigned UGC Website, UTSAH and Professor of Practice Portal on May 16 2023, at 11:00 am by Prof. M. Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman University Grants Commission, New Delhi. The University Grants Commission has redesigned the UGC website to make it more user-friendly, informative, and dynamic. To effectively track and support the implementation of transformative reforms and strategic initiatives across Higher Educational Institutions (HEIs) in our country, UGC has developed UTSAH (Undertaking Transformative Strategies and Actions in Higher Education) portal. In addition, keeping in line with the NEP policy direction, UGC has also developed a Professor of Practice portal to facilitate HEIs in finding the right Professor of Practice and vice versa. In this regard, Prof. M. Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman University Grants Commission, New Delhi, will launch the Redesigned UGC Website, UTSAH and Professor of Practice Portal on May 16 2023, at 11:00 am. For joining the event, the Zoom Meeting Link is given below: Meeting ID: 826 5177 2079 Passcode: 847508 Date Time: May 16, 2023, 11:00 am The event will be a live webcast on UGC s Social Media handles at: UGC Youtube: UGC Twitter: UGC Facebook: I request you to kindly join the event as per the schedule. A copy of the e.Invitation is attached. With kind regards UGC, New Delhi E-Invitation
content.original_text:
Launch of Redesigned UGC Website, UTSAH & Professor of Practice Portal
Launch of Redesigned UGC Website, UTSAH and Professor of Practice Portal on May 16 2023, at 11:00 am by Prof. M. Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman University Grants Commission, New Delhi.
The University Grants Commission has redesigned the UGC website to make it more user-friendly, informative, and dynamic. To effectively track and support the implementation of transformative reforms and strategic initiatives across Higher Educational Institutions (HEIs) in our country, UGC has developed UTSAH (Undertaking Transformative Strategies and Actions in Higher Education) portal. In addition, keeping in line with the NEP policy direction, UGC has also developed a Professor of Practice portal to facilitate HEIs in finding the right Professor of Practice and vice versa.
In this regard, Prof. M. Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman University Grants Commission, New Delhi, will launch the Redesigned UGC Website, UTSAH and Professor of Practice Portal on May 16 2023, at 11:00 am.
For joining the event, the Zoom Meeting Link is given below:
https://us06web.zoom.us/j/82651772079?pwd=WmYrT0JRa3J5SjZORjNYbzBQSGhMQT09
Meeting ID: 826 5177 2079
Passcode: 847508
Date & Time: May 16, 2023, 11:00 am
The event will be a live webcast on UGC's Social Media handles at:
UGC Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/@universitygrantscommission1504 
UGC Twitter: https://twitter.com/ugc_india 
UGC Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/UniversityGrantsCommission/ 
I request you to kindly join the event as per the schedule. A copy of the e.Invitation is attached.
With kind regards
UGC, New Delhi

content.text: Five BTech Programs have been accredited by the NBA for full six years Five BTech Programs have been accredited by the NBA for full 6 years: Five BTech Programs (Chemical Engg., Computer Science and Engg., Civil Engg., Electrical and Electronics Engg. and Mechanical Engg.) have been Accredited by the NBA for Full Six Years, i.e. Academic Years from 2022-23 to 2027-28 ( valid up to 30-06-2028) under Tier-I 2nd Cycle category. Prof. Prasad Krishna, Director (Additional-charge) has congratulated all the stakeholders including Members of BOG, FC and BWC, Deans, HoDs, Registrar, Joint and Asst. Registrars, Faculty Members, Staff, Students and Alumni for this achievement. The Director congratulated Parents and Employers of the Graduated Students and also thanked them for their involvement in the process of Accreditation to achieve this milestone.
content.original_text:
Five BTech Programs have been accredited by the NBA for full six years
Five BTech Programs have been accredited by the NBA for full 6 years:
Five BTech Programs (Chemical Engg., Computer Science and Engg., Civil Engg., Electrical and Electronics Engg. and Mechanical Engg.) have been Accredited by the NBA for Full Six Years, i.e. Academic Years from 2022-23 to 2027-28 ( valid up to 30-06-2028) under Tier-I 2nd Cycle category.
Prof. Prasad Krishna, Director (Additional-charge) has congratulated all the stakeholders including Members of BOG, FC and BWC, Deans, HoDs, Registrar, Joint and Asst. Registrars, Faculty Members, Staff, Students and Alumni for this achievement. The Director congratulated Parents and Employers of the Graduated Students and also thanked them for their involvement in the process of Accreditation to achieve this milestone.

content.text: UGC s National Webinar on India s Arctic policy:Scope Opportunities UGC is organizing a National Webinar on India s Arctic policy: Scope Opportunities on 9th December 2022 from 2:00 PM onwards Respected Madam Sir, This is with reference to the UGC s earlier letter no. D.O. No.1-2112021(SWAYAM) dated 12.04.2022(copy attached), wherein UGC has informed regarding the release of India s Arctic policy, by the Government of India. UGC has also requested all the Higher Education institutions (HEls) to submit proposals for the development of MOOCs at the UG PG level for the SWAYAM Platform on the six pillars of India s Arctic Policy (IAP) and requested HEls to create awareness among Universities, Colleges about the availability of courses, jobs and research opportunities in the area of Arctic Polar Studies. In this regard, UGC is organizing a National Webinar on India s Arctic policy: Scope Opportunities on 9th December 2022 from 2:00 PM onwards ( A copy of the UGC letter is attached herewith for your kind perusal, please. With kind regards UGC, New Delhi Letter YouTube Link
content.original_text:
UGC's National Webinar on "India's Arctic policy:Scope & Opportunities"
UGC is organizing a National Webinar on "India's Arctic policy: Scope & Opportunities" on 9th December 2022 from 2:00 PM onwards
Respected Madam/Sir,
This is with reference to the UGC's earlier letter no. D.O. No.1-2112021(SWAYAM) dated 12.04.2022(copy attached), wherein UGC has informed regarding the release of India's Arctic policy, by the Government of India. UGC has also requested all the Higher Education institutions (HEls) to submit proposals for the development of MOOCs at the UG/PG level for the SWAYAM Platform on the six pillars of India's Arctic Policy (IAP) and requested HEls to create awareness among Universities, Colleges about the availability of courses, jobs and research opportunities in the area of Arctic/Polar Studies.
In this regard, UGC is organizing a National Webinar on "India's Arctic policy: Scope & Opportunities" on 9th December 2022 from 2:00 PM onwards (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hGE8ZIALqgU). A copy of the UGC letter is attached herewith for your kind perusal, please.
With kind regards
UGC, New Delhi
Letter
YouTube Link
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hGE8ZIALqgU&authuser=0

content.text: Post-Budget Webinar on Unleashing the Potential Ease of living - 28 2 23 Post-Budget Webinar Sessions on Unleashing the Potential Ease of living using Technology - 28th February, 2023 Post-Budget Webinar Sessions on Unleashing the Potential Ease of living using Technology, coordinated by Ministry of Electronics IT(MeitY) and Department of Promotion of Industry Internal Trade (DPIIT) are scheduled to be held on 28th February, 2023. The Hon ble Prime Minister will address the inaugural session at 10 am (schedule attached) . The Registration link for joining the Webinar is : For viewing,the link is The post-budget webinar is envisaged to improve the implementation of the budget announcements related to Ease of Living and Ease of Doing Business. The topics will cover Entity Digilocker, one stop solution for identity and address updating, setting up of 3 Centre of Excellence on Artificial Intelligence, 5G, E-Courts, National Data Governance Policy, Mission Karmayogi etc. among other things. Higher Education Institutions are requested to share the details of the webinar with their students, faculty members and other stakeholders and participate in large numbers. You are also requested to share the number of participants from your HEI in the Webinar at the following link : latest by 4 pm tomorrow ( 28th February, 2023). Brochure Agenda
content.original_text:
Post-Budget Webinar on Unleashing the Potential Ease of living - 28/2/23
Post-Budget Webinar Sessions on Unleashing the Potential Ease of living using Technology - 28th February, 2023 
Post-Budget Webinar Sessions on Unleashing the Potential Ease of living using Technology, coordinated by Ministry of Electronics @ IT(MeitY) and Department of Promotion of Industry & Internal Trade (DPIIT) are scheduled to be held on 28th February, 2023. 
The Hon'ble Prime Minister will address the inaugural session at 10 am (schedule attached) .
The Registration link for joining the Webinar is : https://zoom.us/meeting/
For viewing,the link is https://youtube.com/live/p9_
The post-budget webinar is envisaged to improve the implementation of the budget announcements related to Ease of Living and Ease of Doing Business. The topics will cover Entity Digilocker, one stop solution for identity and address updating, setting up of 3 Centre of Excellence on Artificial Intelligence, 5G, E-Courts, National Data Governance Policy, Mission Karmayogi etc. among other things.
Higher Education Institutions are requested to share the details of the webinar with their students, faculty members and other stakeholders and participate in large numbers.
You are also requested to share the number of participants from your HEI in the Webinar at the following link : https://docs.google.com/forms/ latest by 4 pm tomorrow ( 28th February, 2023).
Brochure/Agenda

content.text: Advanced Treatment Technologies for Fluoride Removal in Water Call for book chapter Advanced Treatment Technologies for Fluoride Removal in Water : Fluoride contamination is affecting the quality of water resources worldwide because of human activities, such as mining and pesticide use. Due to the high risk of fluoride exposure, specific water treatment processes are required to meet more severe water quality standards. A better understanding of currently available processes is necessary to develop economical, efficient, and effective methods for fluoride removal. We are therefore working on an edited monograph, Advanced Treatment Technologies for Fluoride Removal in Water, for publication by Springer. The monograph aims at presenting an overview of the techniques available today for the removal of fluoride contamination pollutants species from water; and will cover traditionally applied and advanced techniques for the removal of fluoride pollutants species, including oxidation, coagulation-flocculation, and membrane techniques. Tentatively, the monograph will be composed of four parts: (1) fluoride status and remediation strategies; (2) fluoride removal treatments; (3) fluoride effect on human health; and (4) status, management, government policy, and environmental regulating bodies. A tentative outline of the proposed monograph is given in the attached flyer. Given your expertise and well-known contribution in the fluoride area, we are delighted to invite you to contribute a chapter. We believe your contribution will significantly enhance the quality of the monograph. You are welcome to collaborate with anybody you deem appropriate. In order to stay on schedule, we would appreciate receiving an abstract by December 31, 2022, and the full-length paper by March 31, 2023. If you accept our invitation, please send a tentative title of your chapter by November 15, 2022 December 15, 2022, to Dr. A.K. Yadav on akyiitbhu or akhileshyadav Brochure Abstract Template
content.original_text:
Advanced Treatment Technologies for Fluoride Removal in Water
Call for book chapter "Advanced Treatment Technologies for Fluoride Removal in Water":
Fluoride contamination is affecting the quality of water resources worldwide because of human activities, such as mining and pesticide use. Due to the high risk of fluoride exposure, specific water treatment processes are required to meet more severe water quality standards. A better understanding of currently available processes is necessary to develop economical, efficient, and effective methods for fluoride removal. We are therefore working on an edited monograph, "Advanced Treatment Technologies for Fluoride Removal in Water,” for publication by Springer. The monograph aims at presenting an overview of the techniques available today for the removal of fluoride contamination/pollutants/species from water; and will cover traditionally applied and advanced techniques for the removal of fluoride pollutants/species, including oxidation, coagulation-flocculation, and membrane techniques. Tentatively, the monograph will be composed of four parts: (1) fluoride status and remediation strategies; (2) fluoride removal treatments; (3) fluoride effect on human health; and (4) status, management, government policy, and environmental regulating bodies. A tentative outline of the proposed monograph is given in the attached flyer.
Given your expertise and well-known contribution in the fluoride area, we are delighted to invite you to contribute a chapter. We believe your contribution will significantly enhance the quality of the monograph. You are welcome to collaborate with anybody you deem appropriate. In order to stay on schedule, we would appreciate receiving an abstract by December 31, 2022, and the full-length paper by March 31, 2023. If you accept our invitation, please send a tentative title of your chapter by November 15, 2022 December 15, 2022, to Dr. A.K. Yadav on akyiitbhu@gmail.com or akhileshyadav@iitb.ac.in.
Brochure
Abstract Template

content.text: UGC, New Delhi, will launch the UGC 4 SWAYAM MOOCs on 6-2-2023 from 2 PM Prof. Mamidala Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman, University Grants Commission, New Delhi, will launch the UGC 4 SWAYAM MOOCs (as given below) on 6th February 2023 from 2:00 pm Onward. 1. The History of Indian Buddhism 2. Buddhist Philosophy 3. Abhidhamma (Pali) 4. Community Engagement and Social Responsibility The Minute to minute programme, in this regard is attached herewith. For joining the event, the Zoom Meeting Link is as below : Meeting ID: 871 6878 7034 Passcode: 309376 Date Time: Feb 6, 2023, 02:00 PM Program Schedule The event will be live webcast on UGC s Social Media handle at : UGC Youtube :- UGC Twitter : UGC Facebook :-
content.original_text:
UGC, New Delhi, will launch the UGC 4 SWAYAM MOOCs on 6-2-2023 from 2 PM
Prof. Mamidala Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman, University Grants Commission, New Delhi, will launch the UGC 4 SWAYAM MOOCs (as given below) on 6th February 2023 from 2:00 pm Onward.
1. The History of Indian Buddhism
2. Buddhist Philosophy
3. Abhidhamma (Pali)
4. Community Engagement and Social Responsibility
The Minute to minute programme, in this regard is attached herewith.
For joining the event, the Zoom Meeting Link is as below : 
https://us06web.zoom.us/j/87168787034?pwd=VUcvdFNZN3MxQ3E5Q3dUb01RdzlmZz09

content.text: Vishesh NITI Distinguished Lecture series - India 75 As a part of India, the Vishesh NITI Distinguished Lecture series organised by the Ministry of External Affairs,The School of Humanities, Social Sciences and Management is conducting a session by the former Indian Ambassador to Japan , Ms.Deepa Gopalan Wadhwa on The Importance of Economic Diplomacy with a focus on India-Japan Relations on 27-01-2023 at 3 PM in the Main Seminar Hall, NITK. Ms.Wadhwa has served as the ambassador to a number of countries such as Latvia, Qatar and Sweden.
content.original_text:
Vishesh NITI Distinguished Lecture series - India @ 75
As a part of India@75, the Vishesh NITI Distinguished Lecture series organised by the Ministry of External Affairs,The School of Humanities, Social Sciences and Management is conducting a session by the former Indian Ambassador to Japan , Ms.Deepa Gopalan Wadhwa on "The Importance of Economic Diplomacy with a focus on India-Japan Relations" on 27-01-2023 at 3 PM in the Main Seminar Hall, NITK. 
Ms.Wadhwa has served as the ambassador to a number of countries such as Latvia, Qatar and Sweden.

content.text: Talk on Taking Inspiration From India s Educational Heritage on 22 11 22 The UGC initiated an online lecture series on Best Practices in Higher Education. Eminent persons from different fields are invited on UGC platform to share the best practices followed in their institution organization for the benefit of higher educational institutions, faculty members and students. In this lecture series, Ms. Sahana Singh will be delivering a talk on Taking Inspiration From India?s Educational Heritage on 22nd November, 2022 at 07:30 PM (IST). Ms. Sahana Singh is an author and commentator based in Ithaca, New York, USA. The lecture will be live webcast on twitter handle at and YouTube Channel of UGC at I thake this opportunity to invite you to kindly join the online lecture and also request you to bring this to the notice of all faculty members and students of your institutions and encourage them to join the programme. A Secretary, UGC letter with e-invite is also attached herewith for your kind perusal please. With kind regards UGC, New Delhi In case any queries suggestion, Please contact us contact.ugc
content.original_text:
Talk on Taking Inspiration From India's Educational Heritage on 22/11/22
The UGC initiated an online lecture series on Best Practices in Higher Education. Eminent persons from different fields are invited on UGC platform to share the best practices followed in their institution/organization for the benefit of higher educational institutions, faculty members and students. In this lecture series, Ms. Sahana Singh will be delivering a talk on Taking Inspiration From India?s Educational Heritage on 22nd November, 2022 at 07:30 PM (IST). Ms. Sahana Singh is an author and commentator based in Ithaca, New York, USA. The lecture will be live webcast on twitter handle at @ugc_india and YouTube Channel of UGC at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClbbWYTjSiXnhShJ0Z1-05g/featured I thake this opportunity to invite you to kindly join the online lecture and also request you to bring this to the notice of all faculty members and students of your institutions and encourage them to join the programme. A Secretary, UGC letter with e-invite is also attached herewith for your kind perusal please. With kind regards UGC, New Delhi
In case any queries/suggestion, Please contact us contact.ugc@nic.in

content.text: First year mechanical engineering orientation program B. Tech. Mechanical Engineering Orientation Program 2022 : After the Orientation Program at Silver Jubilee Auditorium on 10 November, 2022 for the first year B. Tech. students, the Orientation Program for the 1st Year B. Tech. Mechanical Engineering students will be conducted in the Dept. of Mechanical Engineering at 1:30 PM. All the First year mechanical engineering students (only the students are allowed) are requested to be present in the department on 10-11-2022 by 1:30 PM sharp. content.original_text:
First year mechanical engineering orientation program
B. Tech. Mechanical Engineering Orientation Program 2022 :
After the Orientation Program at Silver Jubilee Auditorium on 10 November, 2022 for the first year B. Tech. students, the Orientation Program for the 1st Year B. Tech. Mechanical Engineering students will be conducted in the Dept. of Mechanical Engineering at 1:30 PM. All the First year mechanical engineering students (only the students are allowed) are requested to be present in the department on 10-11-2022 by 1:30 PM sharp. Attendance for the Induction program is compulsory.
Prof. Ravikiran Kadoli
Head, Dept. of Mechanical Engineering

content.text: Celebration of Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas on 15th November, 2022 Celebration of Birth Anniversary of Bhagwan Birsa Munda, as Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas on 15th November, 2022: The Government of India has declared 15th November, i.e., the birth Anniversary of Bhagwan Birsa Munda, as Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas every year. In order to celebrate the occasion on 15th November 2022 in the higher educational institutions, following activities may be considered to be carried out in the institutions: 1. The legacy of tribal leaders like Bhagawan Birsa Munda, as well as other great personalities and unsung heroes of Janjati communities, be disseminated. 2. On this occasion and Aazadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav (AKAM), debate competition on the theme Contribution of Janjati Heroes in Freedom Struggle be held amongst students, and the students be felicitated for their work. UGC Letter
content.original_text:
Celebration of 'Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas' on 15th November, 2022
Celebration of Birth Anniversary of Bhagwan Birsa Munda, as 'Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas' on 15th November, 2022:
The Government of India has declared 15th November, i.e., the birth Anniversary of Bhagwan Birsa Munda, as 'Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas' every year. In order to celebrate the occasion on 15th November 2022 in the higher educational institutions, following activities may be considered to be carried out in the institutions:
1. The legacy of tribal leaders like Bhagawan Birsa Munda, as well as other great personalities and unsung heroes of Janjati communities, be disseminated.
2. On this occasion and Aazadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav (AKAM), debate competition on the theme 'Contribution of Janjati Heroes in Freedom Struggle' be held amongst students, and the students be felicitated for their work.
UGC Letter

content.text: National Unity Day (Rashtriya Ekta Diwas) from 25.10.2022 to 31.10.2022 To celebrate the life and contributions of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, an exhibition titled Sardar Patel - The Architect of Unification has been curated jointly by the Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts (IGNCA) and Indian Council of Historical Research (ICHR). This exhibition, in Hindi and English, is available in digital format at the website address It is requested that the exhibition may be put up at prominent places, where a large number of people can see it to ensure its massive outreach. In view of the above, all the higher educational institutions and their affiliated colleges institutions are requested to curate a special exhibition on the life of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel from 25th to 31st October 2022, which may be made available in regional languages. UGC Letter
content.original_text:
National Unity Day (Rashtriya Ekta Diwas) from 25.10.2022 to 31.10.2022
To celebrate the life and contributions of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, an exhibition titled "Sardar Patel - The Architect of Unification" has been curated jointly by the Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts (IGNCA) and Indian Council of Historical Research (ICHR). This exhibition, in Hindi and English, is available in digital format at the website address https://amritmahotsav.nic.in/unity-festival.htm. It is requested that the exhibition may be put up at prominent places, where a large number of people can see it to ensure its massive outreach.
In view of the above, all the higher educational institutions and their affiliated colleges/institutions are requested to curate a special exhibition on the life of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel from 25th to 31st October 2022, which may be made available in regional languages.
UGC Letter

content.original_text:
Postponement of 20th Annual Convocation
Postponement of 20th Annual Convocation:
Dear Graduands
With regret we announce that the 20th Annual convocation of the Institute, which is scheduled to be held on 24th September 2022 has been postponed to a later date due to unavoidable circumstances. The new date will be announced later. 
Dean (Academic )

content.text: New M-Tech Programme on Power Electronics Control for Electric Vehicle New M-Tech Programme on Power Electronics and Control for Electric Vehicle: Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering started New M-Tech Programme on Power Electronics and Control for Electric Vehicle Sponsored by Bosch Global Software Private limited(BGSW) Bangalore in Hybrid mode (classes online and Exams at NITK Surathkal). The maximum student intake for the programme is 40 as per the framework of the customized PG Programmes at NITK Surathkal. The classes will start from 25th October 2022.
content.original_text:
New M-Tech Programme on Power Electronics & Control for Electric Vehicle
New M-Tech Programme on Power Electronics and Control for Electric Vehicle:
Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering started New M-Tech Programme on Power Electronics and Control for Electric Vehicle Sponsored by Bosch Global Software Private limited(BGSW) Bangalore in Hybrid mode (classes online and Exams at NITK Surathkal). The maximum student intake for the programme is 40 as per the framework of the customized PG Programmes at NITK Surathkal. The classes will start from 25th October 2022.

content.text: Shikshak Parv 2022:National Level Online Panel Discussion Shikshak Parv 2022: National Level Online Panel Discussion (5th-9th September 2022): Every year Shikshak Parv, (Teacher s Day) is celebrated on 5th September to commemorate the birth anniversary of the former President of India Dr. S. Radhakrishnan. On this occasion, UGC is organizing 5-day online National Level Panel Discussions from 5th to 09th September 2022 on various subject themes. The sessions will be chaired by eminent persons with distinguished panelists from the academic fraternity. On 5th September UGC will also be launching Research Grant Fellowship Schemes and e-Samadhan Portal. UGC Letter
content.original_text:
Shikshak Parv 2022:National Level Online Panel Discussion
Shikshak Parv 2022: National Level Online Panel Discussion (5th-9th September 2022):
Every year Shikshak Parv, (Teacher's Day) is celebrated on 5th September to commemorate the birth anniversary of the former President of India Dr. S. Radhakrishnan.
On this occasion, UGC is organizing 5-day online National Level Panel Discussions from 5th to 09th September 2022 on various subject themes. The sessions will be chaired by eminent persons with distinguished panelists from the academic fraternity. On 5th September UGC will also be launching Research Grant/Fellowship Schemes and e-Samadhan Portal. 
UGC Letter

content.text: First Year Hostel Admission (Ph.D., MTech, MBA, MSc, and MCA) First Year Hostel Admission (Ph.D., MTech, MBA, MSc, and MCA): The hostel room selection and the mess selection happen through the IRIS hostel dashboard from 10.08.2022, Wednesday 10.30 am onwards in two sessions. Session 1:10.30 am to 8 pm only for girls for Ph.D. and PG. Session 2: From 8 pm onwards both for boys and Girls for Ph.D. and PG. The student can select the room and the mess of their wish purely on the First come First Taken policy. Follow the flash news in IRIS dashboard for more updates. 1. Link to the hostel dashboard user manual: 2. Message from the Chief Warden
content.original_text:
First Year Hostel Admission (Ph.D., MTech, MBA, MSc, and MCA)
First Year Hostel Admission (Ph.D., MTech, MBA, MSc, and MCA):
The hostel room selection and the mess selection happen through the IRIS hostel dashboard from 10.08.2022, Wednesday 10.30 am onwards in two sessions.
Session 1: 10.30 am to 8 pm only for girls for Ph.D. and PG.
Session 2: From 8 pm onwards both for boys' and Girls for Ph.D. and PG.
The student can select the room and the mess of their wish purely on the First come First Taken policy. Follow the flash news in IRIS dashboard for more updates.
1. Link to the hostel dashboard user manual: https://irisni.tk/hostel_aug2022
2. Message from the Chief Warden

content.text: UGC online lecture series on Best Practices in Higher Education UGC online lecture series on Best Practices in Higher Education : the UGC has initiated an online lecture series on Best Practices in Higher Education . Eminent persons from different fields are invited every month on UCC platform to share the best practices followed in their institution organization for the benefit of higher educational institutions, faculty members and students. In this lecture series, Padma Shri Sridhar Vembu, Founder and CEO, ZOHO Corporation will be delivering a talk on Transforming our rural areas: Skill creation and rural industrialization on 30ti May, 2022 at 10.30 am. The lecture will be live webcast on Twitter handle at: and YouTube channel of UGC at: Letter of Invitation
content.original_text:
UGC online lecture series on "Best Practices in Higher Education"
UGC online lecture series on "Best Practices in Higher Education" :
the UGC has initiated an online lecture series on "Best Practices in Higher Education". Eminent persons from different fields are invited every month on UCC platform to share the best practices followed in their institution/organization for the benefit of higher educational institutions, faculty members and students.
In this lecture series, Padma Shri Sridhar Vembu, Founder and CEO, ZOHO Corporation will be delivering a talk on "Transforming our rural areas: Skill creation and rural industrialization" on 30ti May, 2022 at 10.30 am.
The lecture will be live webcast on Twitter handle at: @ugc_india and YouTube channel of UGC at: https://youtu.be/susOqDr2kFA
Letter of Invitation

content.text: Admission to M.Tech. under CCMT 2022 Admission to M.Tech. under CCMT 2022: Registration for the Centralized Counseling for M.Tech. admission (CCMT 2022) has started from 23rd May, 2022. Kindly visit for more information. The last date of registration and fee payment is 12 June, 2022. You can directly apply for admission in 61 different technical institutes including (National Institute of Technologies (NITs), Indian Institute of Information Technologies (IIITs), IIEST Shibpur, and some Government Funded Technical Institutes (GFTIs) through CCMT 2022. You can choose your order of preferences from institutes among the M.Tech. M.Arch. M.Plan. M.Des. Programs in which you are eligible based on your UG degree and GATE paper you have given. Please feel free to contact at ccmt2022help for any query.
content.original_text:
Admission to M.Tech. under CCMT 2022
Admission to M.Tech. under CCMT 2022:
Registration for the Centralized Counseling for M.Tech. admission (CCMT 2022) has started from 23rd May, 2022. Kindly visit https://ccmt.admissions.nic.in/ for more information. The last date of registration and fee payment is 12 June, 2022.
You can directly apply for admission in 61 different technical institutes including (National Institute of Technologies (NITs), Indian Institute of Information Technologies (IIITs), IIEST Shibpur, and some Government Funded Technical Institutes (GFTIs) through CCMT 2022. You can choose your order of preferences from institutes among the M.Tech./ M.Arch./ M.Plan./M.Des. Programs in which you are eligible based on your UG degree and GATE paper you have given.
Please feel free to contact at ccmt2022help@mnit.ac.in for any query.

content.text: National level quiz to commemorate the 75 years of progressive India National level quiz competition to commemorate the 75 years of progressive India : To Celebrate Azadi ka Amrut Mahotsav Ministry of Tourism and the Association of Indian Universities (AIU) brings you the 10th episode Digital Durga-Showcasing The Greatest Festival of Heritage and Art from the 12 episode webinar series Mr. Sarbajit Chakraborty, Co-founder, Digital Durga, Kolkata will be the esteemed speaker for the webinar. This episode will be live on 28th May 2022 at 1100-1200 hrs IST and will be followed by a quiz. To join the webinar, please register on the following link : To participate in the quiz, please click on : (Quiz link will be active on May 28, 2022) Each participant will be awarded a participation certificate and bumper prizes will be announced for the participants who complete all the 12 episodes and the associated quizzes. The event can also be watched on YouTube Channels on Twitter at For any query you may contact Dr. Baljit Singh Sekhon, Joint Secretary (YA S), AIU or Nodal Officer from Ministry of Tourism, Mr. Anil Oraw, Regional Director, email: anil.oraw and Mr. R.K. Suman, Deputy Director General Email: rk.suman1 You are requested to publicise the event and encourage your students and staff to join the programme. Letter AKAM
content.original_text:
National level quiz to commemorate the 75 years of progressive India
National level quiz competition to commemorate the 75 years of progressive India :
To Celebrate 'Azadi ka Amrut Mahotsav' Ministry of Tourism and the Association of Indian Universities (AIU) brings you the 10th episode “Digital Durga-Showcasing The Greatest Festival of Heritage and Art” from the 12 episode webinar series Mr. Sarbajit Chakraborty, Co-founder, Digital Durga, Kolkata will be the esteemed speaker for the webinar. This episode will be live on 28th May 2022 at 1100-1200 hrs IST and will be followed by a quiz. 
To join the webinar, please register on the following link : https://bit.ly/DigitalDurga
To participate in the quiz, please click on : https://bit.ly/DADQuiz
(Quiz link will be active on May 28, 2022)
Each participant will be awarded a participation certificate and bumper prizes will be announced for the participants who complete all the 12 episodes and the associated quizzes. The event can also be watched on YouTube Channels https://www.youtube.com/AIUINDIAD/ https://www.youtube.com/c/incredibleindia & on Twitter at https://twitter.com/AIUIndia. For any query you may contact Dr. Baljit Singh Sekhon, Joint Secretary (YA&S), AIU or Nodal Officer from Ministry of Tourism, Mr. Anil Oraw, Regional Director, email: anil.oraw@nic.in and Mr. R.K. Suman, Deputy Director General Email: rk.suman1@nic.in. You are requested to publicise the event and encourage your students and staff to join the programme.
Letter AKAM

E-invitation

The session will be led by Prof. M. Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman UGC. The program will be live on UGC Twitter handle @ugc_india and also on UGC YouTube Channel https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=kThfCw-DKz4.

content.text: Pareeksha pe Charcha to be held on 1st April, 2022 from 11.00 AM Pareeksha pe Charcha to be held on 1st April, 2022 from 11.00 AM The annual Pareeksha pe Charcha with Hon ble PM is to be held on 1st April, 2022, from 11.00 AM onwards. This is a programme that is highly popular with students and teachers wherein Hon ble PM himself addresses the questions relating to exam anxiety, stress of studies, etc. raised by students from India and abroad. The PM s interaction will be with school students from classes 9 upwards and it will be broadcast live by Doordarshan through DD National, DD News and DD India. It will also be available through live airing on radio channels (All India Radio Medium Wave, All India Radio FM Channel), Live web streaming on websites of PMO, MoE, Doordarshan, MyGov.in and Youtube channel of MoE, Facebook Live and Swayamprabha channels of MoE.
content.original_text:
"Pareeksha pe Charcha” to be held on 1st April, 2022 from 11.00 AM
"Pareeksha pe Charcha” to be held on 1st April, 2022 from 11.00 AM
The annual “Pareeksha pe Charcha” with Hon’ble PM is to be held on 1st April, 2022, from 11.00 AM onwards. This is a programme that is highly popular with students and teachers wherein Hon’ble PM himself addresses the questions relating to exam anxiety, stress of studies, etc. raised by students from India and abroad.
The PM’s interaction will be with school students from classes 9 upwards and it will be broadcast live by Doordarshan through DD National, DD News and DD India. It will also be available through live airing on radio channels (All India Radio Medium Wave, All India Radio FM Channel), Live web streaming on websites of PMO, MoE, Doordarshan, MyGov.in and Youtube channel of MoE, Facebook Live and Swayamprabha channels of MoE.

content.text: Post Budget Webinar on Education and Skill Sector Post Budget Webinar on Education and Skill Sector: The webinar for the Education and Skill sector is scheduled for 2l t February,2022. A Plenary Session to be addressed by the Hon ble Prime Minister at l0:00 AM will also be live webcast at There will be seven parallel break-away sessions on seven identified sub themes from ll:30 AM to l:30 PM and a concluding session where summary of discussions will be presented by each sub group from 3:30 PM to 6:00 PM. A detailed programme and a PowerPoint presentation on the above programme are available at for ready reference. UGC letter regarding Post Budget Webinar on Education and Skill Sector
content.original_text:
Post Budget Webinar on Education and Skill Sector
Post Budget Webinar on Education and Skill Sector:
The webinar for the Education and Skill sector is scheduled for 2l't February,2022. A Plenary Session to be addressed by the Hon'ble Prime Minister at l0:00 AM will also be live webcast at https://pmindiawebcast.nic.in. There will be seven parallel break-away sessions on seven identified sub themes from ll:30 AM to l:30 PM and a concluding session where summary of discussions will be presented by each sub group from 3:30 PM to 6:00 PM. 
A detailed programme and a PowerPoint presentation on the above programme are available at https://www.ugc.ac.in/ugc_notices.aspx?id=NDM5NA== for ready reference.
UGC letter regarding Post Budget Webinar on Education and Skill Sector

content.text: Pariksha Pe Charcha (PPC2022) NITK Surathkal F.No 14-1 2019(CPP-II) 24th January, 2022 Subject:Pariksha Pe Charcha (PPC2022): An interactive program of Hon ble Prime Minister with students, teachers and parents-regarding Respected Madam Sir, This is in continuation to UGC letter FNo 14-1 2019(CPP-II) dated 18 01 2022 regarding the 5th edition of Pariksha Pe Charcha (PPC2022), the unique interactive program of Hon ble Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi with students, teachers and parents to be held through virtual mode in January 2022. In this regard, all Universities and their affiliated Colleges are requested to kindly upload promotional videos of PPC2022 ( on their official websites and also popularise using their social media channels and groups to enable active participation of all stakeholders in this important event in a befitting manner With kind regards, Yours sincerely, (Rajnish Jain )
content.original_text:
Pariksha Pe Charcha (PPC2022) | NITK Surathkal
F.No 14-1/2019(CPP-II) 24th January, 2022
Subject:Pariksha Pe Charcha (PPC2022): An interactive program of Hon'ble Prime Minister with students, teachers and parents-regarding
Respected Madam/ Sir,
This is in continuation to UGC letter FNo 14-1/2019(CPP-II) dated 18/01/ 2022 regarding the 5th edition of Pariksha Pe Charcha (PPC2022), the unique interactive program of Hon'ble Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi with students, teachers and parents to be held through virtual mode in January 2022.
In this regard, all Universities and their affiliated Colleges are requested to kindly upload promotional videos of PPC2022 
(https://we.tl/t-DJdL3vQ0rV) on their official websites and also popularise using their social media channels and groups to enable active participation of all stakeholders in this important event in a befitting manner
With kind regards,
Yours sincerely,
(Rajnish Jain )

content.text: M.Tech M.Sc admission through CCMT CCMN at IRIS portal M.Tech. M.Sc admission through CCMT CCMN at IRIS portal All the candidates who have confirmed their seats for M.Tech. M.Sc programmes at NITK Surathkal through CCMT CCMN by paying the balance fee at CCMT CCMN, are hereby informed that the last date for admission to NITK through the NITK IRIS portal has been extended to 6th September 2021. The dates for document verification by NITK officials have been extended till 10th September 2021. The admission orders will be issued only after completion of the document verification process.
content.original_text:
M.Tech/M.Sc admission through CCMT/CCMN at IRIS portal
M.Tech./M.Sc admission through CCMT/CCMN at IRIS portal
All the candidates who have confirmed their seats for M.Tech./M.Sc programmes at NITK Surathkal through CCMT/CCMN by paying the balance fee at CCMT/CCMN, are hereby informed that the last date for admission to NITK through the NITK IRIS portal has been extended to 6th September 2021. The dates for document verification by NITK officials have been extended till 10th September 2021. The admission orders will be issued only after completion of the document verification process.

content.original_text:
4th edition of Pariksha Pe Charcha
All the Students, Faculty and Staff are hereby requested to participate in the 4th edition of Pariksha Pe Charcha, the unique interactive program of Hon'ble Prime minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi ji with students, teachers and parents. The program will be aired at 7 PM on Wednesday 7th April, 2021 on TV channels and digital media”
The promo film can be accessed at https://twitter.com/narendramodi/status/137891247501 0138114?s=24.

content.text: Admission Portal for MCA Admissions for the Academic Year 2021-22 Admission Portal for MCA Admissions for the Academic Year 2021-22 is open The admission to the MCA programmes of the participating NITs is carried out through the NIMCET common platform. The process has commenced on the website NIMCET-2021 Interested candidates may please visit the website, register themselves and apply through the said website portal online. All the information regarding the procedure of admission, Information Brochure, Seat Matrix, etc. are available on the said website.
content.original_text:
Admission Portal for MCA Admissions for the Academic Year 2021-22
Admission Portal for MCA Admissions for the Academic Year 2021-22 is open 
The admission to the MCA programmes of the participating NITs is carried out through the NIMCET common platform. The process has commenced on the website NIMCET-2021 Interested candidates may please visit the website, register themselves and apply through the said website portal online. All the information regarding the procedure of admission, Information Brochure, Seat Matrix, etc. are available on the said website.

content.text: Update on Students Returning to Campus In view of the spread of mutated form of Corona Virus, the registration for the returning of PhD PG students (as per 12.11.2020 and 20.12.2020 notifications) to the institute is temporarily put on hold until further notice. Any inconvenience is regretted. Further, those students who have already booked the journey tickets (booking done before 9.00pm on 30-12-2020) and have undergone RT-PCR test may send an email to misofficer with the following data before 5.00pm on 31-12-2020. 1. Copy of the journey ticket 2. RT-PCR test report 3. Consent letter from the guide. 4. Undertaking by the student and the parent. PG-Undertaking-Guide (PDF) PG-Undertaking-Student(PDF)
content.original_text:
Update on Students Returning to Campus
In view of the spread of mutated form of Corona Virus, the registration for the returning of PhD & PG students (as per 12.11.2020 and 20.12.2020 notifications) to the institute is temporarily put on hold until further notice. Any inconvenience is regretted.
Further, those students who have already booked the journey tickets (booking done before 9.00pm on 30-12-2020) and have undergone RT-PCR test may send an email to misofficer@nitk.edu.in with the following data before 5.00pm on 31-12-2020.
1. Copy of the journey ticket
2. RT-PCR test report
3. Consent letter from the guide.
4. Undertaking by the student and the parent.
PG-Undertaking-Guide (PDF)
PG-Undertaking-Student(PDF)

Kind Attention JEE (Main) 2020 qualified candidates in JOSAA:
Dear Candidates, 
Please find information regarding which document should be treated as State eligibility proof and
weblinks for getting templates of conversion to GEN Category and the medical certificate in part A,
B and C, respectively. 
Part-A 
Regarding State of eligibility proof of Place of Passing Class XII: Candidate is supposed to upload

Part - B
Format for declaration by the Candidate for Conversion to GEN Category
Part - C
Medical Certificate Format

GEN EWS Certificate Format 3. PWD Certificate : a. FORM-PwD (II) - In cases of amputation or complete permanent paralysis of limbs and in cases of blindness b. FORM-PwD (III) - In cases of multiple disabilities. c. FORM-PwD(IV) - In cases other than those mentioned in Forms II and III d. Format of Medical Certificate (Dyslexia) 4. OBC NCL Certificate Format 5. SC ST Certificate Format 6. Format of Affidavit for PwD Candidates 7. Format of Self Declaration About Course Completion 8. Sponsorship(Deputation) NOC Certificate 9. Undertaking to be submitted by GEN-EWS Candidates 10. Undertaking to be submitted by OBC-NCL Candidates 11. PhD Application User Manual Fill-up the Online Application Form Any query e- mail: 1. PhD Regulations and admissions related query: aracademic 2. Technical query: misofficer Phone: 91-0824-2473003, 91-0824-2473020 4071
content.original_text:
Call for Admission to M.Tech/M.Tech(Res) and Ph.D Programmes 2020-21
1. INFORMATION BULLETIN- Admission to M.Tech/M.Tech(Research) and Ph.D programmes 2020-21
2. GEN EWS Certificate Format
3. PWD Certificate :
a. FORM-PwD (II) - In cases of amputation or complete permanent paralysis of
limbs and in cases of blindness
b. FORM-PwD (III) - In cases of multiple disabilities.
c. FORM-PwD(IV) - In cases other than those mentioned in Forms II and III
d. Format of Medical Certificate (Dyslexia)
4. OBC NCL Certificate Format
5. SC/ST Certificate Format
6. Format of Affidavit for PwD Candidates
7. Format of Self Declaration About Course Completion
8. Sponsorship(Deputation)/NOC Certificate
9. Undertaking to be submitted by GEN-EWS Candidates
10. Undertaking to be submitted by OBC-NCL Candidates
11. PhD Application User Manual
Fill-up the Online Application Form
Any query e- mail: 1. PhD Regulations and admissions related
query: aracademic@nitk.edu.in
2. Technical query: misofficer@nitk.edu.in
Phone: +91-0824-2473003, +91-0824-2473020 / 4071

Tech (by Research only and not the regular M. Tech) students to return to the campus to carry out their project work from 15-02-2021 onwards. Interested students may go through the SOPs and register using the google forms link given below: . content.text: Deeksha M S recieves Best Outgoing Female Student Award Deeksha M. S., Final Year BTech ECE and NITK IEEE Student Branch Chair received the prestigious Shri Prahlad P Chhabria best outgoing female student award for the year 2021 by Hope Foundation in association with the IEEE India Council and Women In Engineering Affinity Group. This award applauds the academic and professional achievements of young women for their accomplishments in the areas of Science, Engineering and Technology. The award comprises a prize of Rs.1,25,000 - (Rupees One Lac Twenty Five Thousand Only), a medal and a citation which is sponsored by Hope Foundation.
content.original_text:
Deeksha M S recieves Best Outgoing Female Student Award
Deeksha M. S., Final Year BTech ECE and NITK IEEE Student Branch Chair received the prestigious Shri Prahlad P Chhabria best outgoing female student award for the year 2021 by Hope Foundation in association with the IEEE India Council and Women In Engineering Affinity Group. This award applauds the academic and professional achievements of young women for their accomplishments in the areas of Science, Engineering and Technology. The award comprises a prize of Rs.1,25,000/- (Rupees One Lac Twenty Five Thousand Only), a medal and a citation which is sponsored by Hope Foundation. http://hfrc-ieeeawards.org/index.php/winners-2021/

content.text: Ms. Anjana VM received the Best Poster award at the MD International Ph.D. Scholar Ms. Anjana VM received the Best Poster award at the MD International Conference, jointly organized by JNCASR and CECAM, at JNCASR Bangalore on 29th February 2024. Please upload the following information to our institute website. Best Poster award for the technical paper entitled, Halide ions permeation through lipid bilayer: Interplay between charge density and water affinity by Anjana VM and D. Chakraborty, sponsored by the American Institute of Physics at the MD International conference jointly organized by JNCSAR-CECAM held on 26th-29th Feb 2024.
content.original_text:
Ms. Anjana VM received the Best Poster award at the MD@60 International
Ph.D. Scholar Ms. Anjana VM received the Best Poster award at the MD@60 International Conference, jointly organized by JNCASR and CECAM, at JNCASR Bangalore on 29th February 2024. Please upload the following information to our institute website.
Best Poster award for the technical paper entitled, “ Halide ions permeation through lipid bilayer: Interplay between charge density and water affinity ” by Anjana VM and D. Chakraborty, sponsored by the American Institute of Physics at the MD@60 International conference jointly organized by JNCSAR-CECAM held on 26th-29th Feb 2024.

content.text: BTech students Yogesh Srikar Siddharth won the 2020 NFS CPS challenge BTech students Yogesh Srikar Siddharth won the 2020 NFS CPS challenge conducted by Arizona State University . Congratulations to Yogesh and Srikar Siddharth, 2nd BTech ECE students, NITK Surathkal !!!! Yogesh and K. Srikar Siddharth had represented NITK in the NFS CPS-vo challenge 2020 conducted by Arizona State University(ASU). This was an International Robotics competition where students from USA and India participated in this competition. Participants included undergrad students, graduates, and MTech Research students. Every team had to simulate their drone on the Mars Surface. More details of the competition along with the videos and the competing team details are given in the link: and the competition results were announced live on youtube session: NITK Team was the only Team from India to participate and win this Competition.
content.original_text:
BTech students Yogesh & Srikar Siddharth won the 2020 NFS CPS challenge
BTech students Yogesh & Srikar Siddharth won the 2020 NFS CPS challenge conducted by Arizona State University
. 
Congratulations to Yogesh and Srikar Siddharth, 2nd BTech ECE students, NITK Surathkal !!!!
Yogesh and K. Srikar Siddharth had represented NITK in the NFS CPS-vo challenge 2020 conducted by Arizona State University(ASU). This was an International Robotics competition where students from USA and India participated in this competition. Participants included undergrad students, graduates, and MTech/Research students. Every team had to simulate their drone on the Mars Surface. More details of the competition along with the videos and the competing team details are given in the link: https://cps-vo.org/group/CPSchallenge and the competition results were announced live on youtube session: https://youtu.be/QMnDKb5b1qQ 
NITK Team was the only Team from India to participate and win this Competition.
￼
